title: How to Make Fish Tacos

steps.headline: Preheat the grill to high heat.
steps.description: Place the onions and bell peppers on the grill and cook for 12 minutes, turning occasionally.

steps.headline: Remove the vegetables from the grill and allow to cool for 3-5 minutes.
steps.description: Thinly slice the onion and bell peppers, discarding of the stems. Place them in a small bowl and add a dash of salt and pepper. Set aside.

steps.headline: Sprinkle salt and pepper onto each side of the tilapia fillets.
Coat a large skillet with non-stick cooking spray.
steps.description: Heat it over medium-high heat, and then add the fish to the pan. Cook each side for about 3 minutes. Fish should flake easily with a fork when finished.

steps.headline: Warm up the tortillas by placing them in the oven or microwave until they have softened.
steps.description: Serve each tortilla with fish, onion, bell pepper, jalapeño slices, and lime juice. Garnish with chopped tomatoes, cilantro, avocado, and/or sour cream if desired.

methods.name: Grilled Halibut Tacos with Guacamole Sauce

steps.headline: Preheat a grill pan to high heat.
steps.description: Brush some extra-virgin olive oil onto each side of the filets and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Grill each side of the fish for about 5 minutes, or until opaque and easy to flake with a fork.
steps.description: Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over each filet as it finishes cooking and then remove it from the grill.

steps.headline: Combine the avocado, lemon juice, cayenne pepper, yogurt, and salt in a food processor.
steps.description: Mix until a smooth sauce has formed, and then transfer the sauce to a small bowl. Add in the diced tomatoes and chopped scallions. Finely chop the cabbage and place it in a separate bowl.

steps.headline: Heat the tortillas in the microwave or in the oven until they have softened.
steps.description: Serve the tortillas with fish, shredded lettuce, and guacamole sauce. Break the fish apart into large chunks before serving.

steps.headline: Preheat the grill to high heat.
steps.description: Coat each piece of swordfish with olive oil to prevent it from sticking. Combing the garlic powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and rub the mixture generously onto each steak.

steps.headline: Grill the swordfish for 3-4 minutes on each side.
steps.description: The swordfish should be opaque and grill-marked when finished.

steps.headline: Make the salsa.
steps.description: Add the avocado, jalapeño, onion, tomato, chopped cilantro, olive oil and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper and mix well.

steps.headline: Top each swordfish steak with avocado salsa and serve.
steps.description: Serve with soft tortillas, sour cream, and hot sauce is desired.

text: Guilt-Free Tilapia Tacos Preheat the grill to high heat. Place the onions and bell peppers on the grill and cook for 12 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove the vegetables from the grill and allow to cool for 3-5 minutes. Thinly slice the onion and bell peppers, discarding of the stems. Place them in a small bowl and add a dash of salt and pepper. Set aside. Sprinkle salt and pepper onto each side of the tilapia fillets.  Coat a large skillet with non-stick cooking spray. Heat it over medium-high heat, and then add the fish to the pan. Cook each side for about 3 minutes. Fish should flake easily with a fork when finished. Warm up the tortillas by placing them in the oven or microwave until they have softened. Serve each tortilla with fish, onion, bell pepper, jalapeño slices, and lime juice. Garnish with chopped tomatoes, cilantro, avocado, and/or sour cream if desired. Grilled Halibut Tacos with Guacamole Sauce Preheat a grill pan to high heat. Brush some extra-virgin olive oil onto each side of the filets and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Grill each side of the fish for about 5 minutes, or until opaque and easy to flake with a fork. Squeeze the juice of 1 lime over each filet as it finishes cooking and then remove it from the grill. Combine the avocado, lemon juice, cayenne pepper, yogurt, and salt in a food processor. Mix until a smooth sauce has formed, and then transfer the sauce to a small bowl. Add in the diced tomatoes and chopped scallions. Finely chop the cabbage and place it in a separate bowl. Heat the tortillas in the microwave or in the oven until they have softened. Serve the tortillas with fish, shredded lettuce, and guacamole sauce. Break the fish apart into large chunks before serving. Swordfish Tacos with Avocado Salsa Preheat the grill to high heat. Coat each piece of swordfish with olive oil to prevent it from sticking. Combing the garlic powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper in a small bowl and rub the mixture generously onto each steak. Grill the swordfish for 3-4 minutes on each side. The swordfish should be opaque and grill-marked when finished. Make the salsa. Add the avocado, jalapeño, onion, tomato, chopped cilantro, olive oil and lemon juice in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper and mix well. Top each swordfish steak with avocado salsa and serve. Serve with soft tortillas, sour cream, and hot sauce is desired.
